snippet: Mark Sanford, who turned the phrase “hiking the Appalachian Trail” into a euphemism for an affair, is one of 18 candidates vying for a Congressional seat in South Carolina.
abstract: South Carolina's former Republican governor Mark Sanford, who made headlines by turning phrase 'hiking the Appalachian Trail' into euphemism for extramarital affair, is one of 18 candidates running in primary election for Congressional seat in South Carolina.
lead_paragraph: Mark Sanford, who turned the phrase “hiking the Appalachian Trail” into a euphemism for an affair, is one of 18 candidates vying for a Congressional seat in South Carolina.

headline.seo: Mark Sanford Seeks a Comeback in a Lively South Carolina Race
headline.main: Ex-Governor Hopes a Lively House Race Is His Comeback Trail
headline.print_headline: Ex-Governor Hopes A Lively House Race Is His Comeback Trail
